pageTitle: Kamui Kobayashi primed for possible return to Formula One with Caterham | Autoweek
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {2388=Kobayashi's return would be well received by both F1 boss Bernie Ecclestone and Honda, owners of the race course at Suzuka, because it should be a major boost for the Japanese Grand Prix. The Japanese GP is scheduled for Oct. 5., 3403=With rookie Marcus Ericsson likely to be in the other car, the team has been keen to secure an experienced driver. Heikki Kovalainen has been in the frame for months and, until recently, was under contract to the team, but he does not have any sponsorship. The same applies to Paul di Resta, the only other experienced driver who competed in 2013 and is without a drive., 2714=Although he last raced in F1 in 2012, Kobayashi is eminently qualified -- having compared well with Sergio Perez at Sauber – and, more importantly, he has sponsorship. Sources told Autoweek that he would bring a team about $6 million., 4568=December 19, 2013, 2466=Kobayashi finished 12th in the 2012 F1 championship with Sauber., 4008=Kamui Kobayashi last drove in Formula One for Sauber in 2012. Photo by LAT PHOTOGRAPHIC}
textBeforeTable: 2015 Formula One Schedule --> Comments See MoreFormula One By Adam Cooper Kobayashi's return would be well received by both F1 boss Bernie Ecclestone and Honda, owners of the race course at Suzuka, because it should be a major boost for the Japanese Grand Prix. The Japanese GP is scheduled for Oct. 5. Kobayashi finished 12th in the 2012 F1 championship with Sauber. Although he last raced in F1 in 2012, Kobayashi is eminently qualified -- having compared well with Sergio Perez at Sauber – and, more
